segments.text: Is there a lot of oil and coal in your country ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There is some , but my country is not amongst the leading producers . The oil and coal deposits are in the north of my country . Your country is a big oil producer , isn ’ t it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it is . My country is famous for having that natural resources . We also have a lot of natural gas .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We have some too . Do you have a lot of coal ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No coal has been discovered in my country , but there may be undiscovered deposits . We don ’ t have many metal deposits .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are a few in my country . We have deposit of gold , but they are very small .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When I traveled around your country , I bought some jewellery made from gold from your country . The jewellery told me that there are few gold mines in your country . The gold was found in mountain steams .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s right . A few people go panning for gold in rivers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You have many trees in your country . That ’ s another natural resources .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s a natural resources that we hardly use . Government policy is to conserve those forests .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . That ’ s probably a good idea . Too many forest are being destroyed .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Is your country ’ s environment being damaged by the oil industry ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We have some inspections , but it is very hard to avoid pollution when extracting oil . There has been some damage , but it is under control .
segments.speaker: S1
